glsa.title: OpenOffice.Org: DOC document Heap Overflow
glsa.synopsis: OpenOffice.Org is vulnerable to a heap overflow when processing DOC documents, which could lead to arbitrary code execution.

background.p: OpenOffice.org is an office productivity suite, including word processing, spreadsheets, presentations, drawings, data charting, formula editing, and file conversion facilities.

description.p: AD-LAB has discovered a heap overflow in the "StgCompObjStream::Load()" function when processing DOC documents.

impact.p: An attacker could design a malicious DOC document containing a specially crafted header which, when processed by OpenOffice.Org, would result in the execution of arbitrary code with the rights of the user running the application.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All OpenOffice.Org users should upgrade to the latest version:
All OpenOffice.Org binary users should upgrade to the latest version:
All OpenOffice.Org Ximian users should upgrade to the latest version:
Note to PPC users: There is no stable OpenOffice.Org fixed version for the PPC architecture. Affected users should switch to the latest OpenOffice.Org Ximian version.
Note to SPARC users: There is no stable OpenOffice.Org fixed version for the SPARC architecture. Affected users should switch to the latest OpenOffice.Org Ximian version.
